definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Zara's now much in demand but why?
sentences.chinese: 萨拉现在成为当红炸子鸡为什么呢？

sentences.english: It's for the crispy chicken you ordered.
sentences.chinese: 这是你点的脆皮炸子鸡的费用。

definition: currently popular (of movie stars, singers etc)
lit. burn your hand, feel the heat (idiom)/fig. arrogance of the powerful/a mighty figure no-one dares approach/hot (exciting or in favor)
to be a big hit/to be hugely popular
tablet announcing the name of leading actor in a theatrical production/by extension, the lead role
(coll.) experienced and usually well-positioned middle-aged man
current favorite/the latest thing/darling (of the market or the media etc)
to become suddenly popular/suddenly all the rage
an up-and-coming youngster/new talent/a brilliant younger generation
